repnme.cdata!:
Bosnia-Herzegovina - Emergency Public Works
            and Employment Project

abstracts.cdata!:
Project ratings are as follows: Project
            outcome is satisfactory; sustainability is likely;
            institutional development impact is modest; World Bank
            performance is satisfactory; and Borrower performance is
            satisfactory. The lessons learned are distilled from
            analyzing the project's strengths and weaknesses:
            Project design proved an effective mechanism to target
            resources to the community level, and empower local
            government and communities in the reconstruction and
            development process. Financing labor-intensive works for
            short-term job creation was an effective strategy in the
            immediate post-conflict environment. To ensure better
            accountability, it is recommended that a more representative
            range of stakeholders be involved in governing future
            operations. The institutional capacity of the implementing
            units needs to be strengthened and new skill areas
            developed, particularly social, economic, and environmental
            analysis. Improving local governance should be at the core
            of any follow-on operation. Greater attention needs to be
            paid to institution-building and to quality of works and
            operations and maintenance in future project design. Any
            future grant financing should be considered within a broader
            municipal finance framework, and better targeted towards
            low-income, non-creditworthy municipalities and poor
            communities. Grants should be performance-based so as to
            provide incentives for institutional improvements. Greater
            attention needs to be paid to monitoring and evaluating the
            impact of investments.

repnme.cdata!:
Bosnia and Herzegovina - Emergency Public
            Works and Employment Project

abstracts.cdata!:
The objectives of the Emergency Public
            Works and Employment Project for Bosnia and Herzegovina are
            to: a) create rapid employment for those unemployed as a
            result of the war; b) rehabilitate small scale public
            infrastructure and clean-up war damaged public property and
            assets; c) reinforce the decision making role and
            responsibilities of municipality governments in municipal
            infrastructure project design and management; and d) deliver
            visible impact at the local level in the short term. The
            project will have two components. Under the first component,
            financing will be provided for public works projects. The
            second component will provide institutional support for the
            establishment and operation of an Employment and Training
            Foundation, in both the Federation and the Republika Srpska,
            to administer project implementation.
